snippet: Rabbis called the gathering of nearly 90,000 in New Jersey the largest celebration of Jewish learning since the destruction of the Second Temple.
abstract: Nearly 90,000 Orthodox Jews gather in communal prayer at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, NJ, for Siyum HaShas, celebration of the completion of a rigorous seven-and-a-half year-long cycle of Talmudic learning; during the cycle, participants around the world study one page of the 2,711-page Babylonian Talmud each day--all of them on the same page, creating a spiritual synchronicity that joins them as Jews.
lead_paragraph: Rabbis called the gathering of nearly 90,000 in New Jersey the largest celebration of Jewish learning since the destruction of the Second Temple.

headline.seo: Nearly 90,000 Jews Celebrate Talmud at MetLife Stadium
headline.main: Orthodox Jews Celebrate Cycle of Talmudic Study
headline.print_headline: Orthodox Jews Celebrate Cycle of Talmudic Study
